pullRequest.body:
Change 100 `linarith`s to `linear_combination`s; this is generally a slight speedup.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #18714 (not strictly blocked by this, but the speed comparison will be more informative after it)
- [ ] depends on: #19120 (not strictly blocked by this, but the two tactics will have more similar unfolding behaviour after it)

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/f5b0bc42-db53-488c-90f0-05ef718a4ec2) for commit 67faf07146674f3c4018b4289a92d91d5e3fdc28.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/b6bc82f1-f16e-4cb7-936b-f0fbfbca30e4/to/f5b0bc42-db53-488c-90f0-05ef718a4ec2) against commit 006c0fc200f2f3c6e3fc3cce6408716a0b428b64:
```diff

+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Slope     instructions   -17.0%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Uniform   instructions   -45.4%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

I have also looked through the diff and aimed to comment on representative examples. Feel free to weight my opinion as you see fit. Overall: there are lots of changes I really like; thanks for starting this conversation!
I think squeezing all `linarith only`s is probably an improvement in speed with no cost to readability.

I have also looked through the diff and aimed to comment on representative examples. Feel free to weight my opinion as you see fit. Overall: there are lots of changes I really like; thanks for starting this conversation!
Let's at least keep this one
Actually: I personally think *this change* is an improvement. What context do you have, @jcommelin, that I don't? I would be interested to hear more.

"keep" as in "keep it in the diff", sorry for the confusion

so we are agreeing
Let's at least keep this one.
This golf works equally well without changing `linarith` to `linear_combination`; moved it to #19319.
The changes in this file also seem an improvement in *both* readability and speed.
This golf works equally well without changing `linarith` to `linear_combination`; moved it to #19319.
In terms of readability, these changes feel like a small net negative to me. Speed improvements could make it worth again.
This is a clear improvement, imho.
This golf works equally well without changing `linarith` to `linear_combination`; moved it to #19319.

I feel neutral about these changes. They are marginally longer, but presumably also marginally clearer to the non-Lean expert: "just add these equations" conveys (slightly) useful information. In other words, I am (personally, though my non-maintainer opinion only counts little) fine with merging these.
Particularly the first looks good to me; the second feels fine.
I am personally unsure if this is an improvement.
Clear improvement, imho.
Nice one! (Perhaps `gcongr` could also be used, but linear_combination is certainly even nicer.)
The changes in this file also look great to me!
This golf works equally well without changing `linarith` to `linear_combination`; moved it to #19319.

This is the only remaining change where I think we're substantially loosing some readability.
Is it possible to keep the `calc` block but change its subproofs?

pullRequest.title: chore: change some `linarith`s to `linear_combination`s
